summary: Variable i first declared in externs.zip/window.js

comments.content:
With r2279, variables named "i" in the global scope give a redeclaration error.

Seems to me like we can find a better way to handle this.
Yeah, it is pretty annoying, but it keeps people from being broken by the stupid browser extension injecting "i".

Can someone take a look at this approach?

https://codereview.appspot.com/6853053/
I think if you just add a @suppress {duplicate}, you won't get a warning.
Yes, but now instead of silently fixing an obscure browser bug automatically for me, I'm required to change my code for a browser I may or may not even care about.
I mean add the suppress to the externs file, not your code
This issue was closed by r2315
